description:
'''Manele''' (from [[Romanian language|Romanian]], ''fem.'' ''sg.'' '''manea'''; ''pl.'' '''manele''', the plural form being more common) is a genre of [[pop folk]] music from [[Romania]].

The manele can be divided into "classical manele" and "modern manele". The "classical manele" are a [[Music of Turkey|Turkish]]-derived genre performed by [[Romani people|Romani]] musicians called [[lăutari]] in a [[Lăutărească music|lăutărească manner]], while the "modern manele" are a mixture of [[Music of Turkey|Turkish]], [[Music of Greece|Greek]], [[Arabic music|Arabic]], [[Music of Bulgaria|Bulgarian]] and [[Music of Serbia|Serbian]] elements, generally using modern (electronic) instruments and beats.

Similar music styles are also present in other [[Balkans|Balkan]] areas, such as [[Bulgaria]], [[Serbia]], [[Montenegro]], [[Albania]], [[Bosnia]], [[Greece]] and [[Turkey]] and with expatriates and emigrants originally from these regions. Related genres are Bulgarian ''[[Chalga]]'' (manele brought by Romanian visitors to Bulgaria is referred to as "Romanian chalga"), Greek modern ''[[Skiladiko]]'' and Serbian ''[[Turbo-folk]]'', each one being a mixture of local folk Greek, Bulgarian and Serbian influences over a [[Pop music|pop]] tune.

mixes.help_reason: I came across many Manele fusion mixes / playlists, but nothing that read as "pure" Manele. It's possible that the mixes I was looking at were "pure", but I don't know enough to make that call.
